001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.pattern.format;
002
003import java.util.function.Consumer;
004
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider;
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder;
007
008/**
009 * Factory for pattern encoders.
010 *
011 * @apiNote This class is for API discoverability. Pattern Encoders do not actually extend
012 * or implement this class.
013 */
014public final class PatternEncoder {
015
016        /**
017         * Pattern encoder URI provider scheme.
018         */
019        public static final String PATTERN_SCHEME = "pattern";
020
021        private PatternEncoder() {
022        }
023
024        /**
025         * Creates a pattern encoder with name of the parent component and will use the
026         * properties from the provided config.
027         * @param builder pattern builder
028         * @return provider of the encoder.
029         */
030        public static Provider<LogEncoder> of(Consumer<PatternEncoderBuilder> builder) {
031                return (name, config) -> {
032                        PatternEncoderBuilder b = new PatternEncoderBuilder(name);
033                        builder.accept(b);
034                        b.fromProperties(config.properties());
035                        return b.build().provide(name, config);
036                };
037        }
038
039        /**
040         * Pattern encoder builder.
041         * @param name name to use for property resolution.
042         * @return builder.
043         * @apiNote {@link #of(Consumer)} is easier to use at will inherit the name and set
044         * the properties.
045         */
046        public PatternEncoderBuilder builder(String name) {
047                return new PatternEncoderBuilder(name);
048        }
049
050}
